content.description:
Same start as Lettonie. Heads Left on the steep wall Follow the instructions to Lac Sylvère.

Park on the north side of the road near the sugar shack drive.

The 3 routes on the left of the cross can be accessed via the snowshoe trail closest to the cliff.
-Hike the road towards the sugar shack and take the climber's trail on the left (white sign).
-Take a left on the second trail you cross (the first is the ski trail, KEEP OFF!)
-Hike along the trail until you see the orange flags on your right.
The scree and blocks at the base of the climbs are still loose and unstable, be careful.

Route Start 46.36047,-74.06262 Unknown
Spare slings and rap rings may be needed.

Obvious route in the centre of the amphitheatre Follow the instructions to Lac Sylvère.

Park on the north side of the road near the sugar shack drive.

The 3 routes on the left of the cross can be accessed via the snowshoe trail closest to the cliff.
-Hike the road towards the sugar shack and take the climber's trail on the left (FQME sign).
-Take a left on the second trail you cross, just after the stream crossing (the first is the ski trail, KEEP OFF!)
-Hike along the trail until you see the orange flags on your right.
The scree and blocks at the base of the climbs are still loose and unstable, be careful.

Route Start 46.36047,-74.06262 Standard ice rack
Spare slings and rap rings may be needed.

On the right of Lettonie. Vertical ice sections with snowy ledges. Follow the instructions to Lac Sylvère.

Park on the north side of the road near the sugar shack drive.

The 3 routes on the left of the cross can be accessed via the snowshoe trail closest to the cliff.
-Hike the road towards the sugar shack and take the climber's trail on the left (white sign).
-Take a left on the second trail you cross (the first is the ski trail, KEEP OFF!)
-Hike along the trail until you see the orange flags on your right.
The scree and blocks at the base of the climbs are still loose and unstable, be careful. Ice and mixed rack
Spare slings and rap rings may be needed.
This area isn't as popular as the right side but has a lot of potential left.
